main event: The report describes a UFO sighting on May 10, 1958, which involved an oblong object the size of a basketball, with one part reported as white and the other as silver. The object was identified as a radiosonde balloon by a Navy jet aircraft.
interesting points: The UFO was observed by both military and civilian sources, as well as detected on ground radar and visually from the air.
The object was oblong in shape and the size of a basketball, with one part described as white and the other part as silver.
It was identified as a radiosonde balloon by a Navy jet aircraft, despite the initial UFO sighting.
The observation took place in Colts Neck, New Jersey, with clear weather conditions at an altitude of 5,000 to 10,000 feet.
The length of the observation was significant, as the object was still in sight for an extended period of time.
result: prozaic explanation - identified as a radiosonde balloon
sighted object: oblong object the size of a basketball
